intro: Secamone elliptica subsp. siamica, commonly known as the Siam secamone, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elliptical, leathery leaves that are often dark green in color. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
